pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing suspension
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:0.4: 7. The training rule on building dwellings
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.1: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Kosambī in Ghosita’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.2: a householder who was a supporter of Venerable Channa said to him,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.3: “I’ll have a dwelling built for you, Venerable, if you would find a site for it.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.4: While Venerable Channa was clearing a site for that dwelling, he felled a tree that served as a shrine and was revered by village, town, district, and kingdom.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.6: “How could the Sakyan monastics fell a tree that serves as a shrine and is revered by village, town, district, and kingdom?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.8: The monks heard the criticism of those people,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.9: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.10: Venerable Channa in the same way.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.11: After rebuking Venerable Channa in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Channa:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.12: “Is it true, Channa, that you did this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.15: “Foolish man, how could you do this?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.18: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.19.1: ‘When a monk builds a large dwelling with a sponsoring owner and intended for himself,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.20: he must have monks approve a site where no harm will be done and which has space on all sides.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.21: If a monk builds a large dwelling on a site where harm will be done and which lacks space on all sides, or he does not have monks approve the site, he commits an offense entailing suspension.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.12: The monk who is building a dwelling should clear a site, then approach the Sangha, put his upper robe over one shoulder, pay respect at the feet of the senior monks, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.13: “Venerables, I want to build a large dwelling with a sponsoring owner and intended for myself.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.14: I request the Sangha to inspect the site for the dwelling.”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.19: then those monks there who are competent and capable—who know where harm will be done and where no harm will be done, and who understands the meaning of having space on all sides and lacking space on all sides—should be asked and then appointed.

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.82: Or he does not have monks approve the site:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.83: if the site has not been approved through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements, and he then builds a dwelling or has one built, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.84: When one piece is left to complete the dwelling, he commits a serious offense.
